required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Postoperative Complication After Free Flap Reconstruction for Head and Neck Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Operation Time and Operators on Postoperative Complication After Free Flap Reconstruction for Patients With Head and Neck Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study was designed to investigate the outcome of free-flap reconstruction surgery following head and neck cancer resection between primary and recurrent head and neck cancer patients.

primary_outcome.description: The condition of the reconstruction flap is failure or success.

secondary_outcome.description: such as wound infection rate, fistula, hematoma, and partial necrosis of the flap

arm_group.arm_group_label: head and neck cancer with free flap reconstruction
arm_group.description: patients with head and neck cancer who underwent tumor wide excision and primary free flap reconstruction or secondary free flap reconstruction between March 2008 and February 2017

intervention.description: Patients with primary tumor which underwent free flap reconstruction group.
intervention.arm_group_label: head and neck cancer with free flap reconstruction

intervention.description: Patients with recurrent tumor which underwent free flap reconstruction group.
intervention.arm_group_label: head and neck cancer with free flap reconstruction

study_pop.textblock: 2,004 patients with head and neck cancer who underwent tumor wide excision and primary free flap reconstruction or secondary free flap reconstruction between March 2008 and February 2017. After excluding missing or unvalidated data, 1,700 patients with a total of 1,791 free flap reconstructions (21 patients received double free flap reconstructions) was left in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with head and neck cancer who underwent tumor wide excision and primary free flap reconstruction or secondary free flap reconstruction between March 2008 and February 2017
- Age: 20~100 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with missing or unvalidated data
- patients less than 20 years old
